text: Philippe Close (born 18 March 1971 in Namur) is a Belgian politician, member of the Socialist Party and the current mayor of the city of Brussels (since 2017). In 2006, he was elected to the Brussels City Council, after which he became alderman. In 2009, he was elected as member of the Brussels Parliament. In 2013, he was considered as successor to Brussels Mayor Freddy Thielemans (PS), but the office went to Yvan Mayeur (PS). Following financial scandals in 2017, Mayeur resigned and was succeeded by Close. ==References== Category:Mayors of the City of Brussels Category:Parti Socialiste (Belgium) politicians Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:21st-century Belgian politicians
title: Philippe Close
